channel.title: Android Client (49% vortex's idea)
channel.description:
[img]http://cdn.crackberry.com/sites/crackberry.com/files/styles/large/public/topic_images/2013/ANDROID.png[/img]
Who would like to help out in porting the RSC client onto the Android mobile platform? i have a small amount of experience with android development and after creating an android project and importing all the RSC code there, obviously there's many errors, but going through them it seems like it's not so far fetched to get something going.
the only external libraries the client uses is Xstream/XPP3 for XML loading. XmlPullParser (XPP3) is available in the android api and Xstream have an android version.
a large amount of the client will function completely fine once the main libraries have been converted to android ones.
That's just to get the project to compile, after that the entire input system would need to be rewritten for touch events. game would need to scale for different screen densities etc.
I can see some great potential for having an Android Client, it would boost the RSC pserver scene allowing people from anywhere on any android device to log on and play. i wouldn't expect people to be PKing on it, but theirs nothing like sitting on a train and mining/fishing on your phone/tablet.
It would also be open source, people can fork it and modify it to their needs for a connection to their own servers.
anyway, if enough interest is generated in this thread ill throw it up on github for everyone and myself to contribute towards.

[/quote]Open source != Free software

https://www.gnu.org/philosophy/open-source-misses-the-point.html

Why french? By the way, nice idea. Support~![/quote]No french.

item.title: Android Client (49% vortex's idea)
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

[quote=“imthenull, post:9, topic:533918”][quote author=xEnt link=topic=652715.msg4373524#msg4373524 date=1381446698]
we would be targeting api 14 (android 4.0+) which uses hardware rendering for it’s 2d graphics, without us worrying about writing opengl code directly.

right now the RSC client uses the java.awt package for it’s Graphics class & Frame, the android versions of these work quite a bit differently but very possible.
[/quote]that sounds really useless in this project unless you plan on converting the camera class to opengl…[/quote]

it will be opengl or at least hardware accelerated. android’s graphics library uses opengl by default i believe as of 3.0+

plus even if it were a direct port, tablets/phones made after 2012 should still be able to run it fine if it’s native code.

Read full topic

item.title: Android Client (49% vortex's idea)
item.dc:creator: @zerratar zerratar
item.description:
@zerratar wrote:

i wrote a client for WP7 and PSVita a year ago. Problem was that it was a complete port and therefor still using software rendering. the gameplay worked in emulator but lagged unbearably on the devices… Maybe you will have more luck with android =)

So I wish you good luck with this project!

PS. this is the reason why i started with the client remake, making it hardware rendered to speed it up. But in the end It depends a bit too much on pc-only libraries

Read full topic

item.title: Android Client (49% vortex's idea)
item.dc:creator: @Nothing1 -Nothing
item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

Also. Get rid of xstream and xmlpull. There are many better ways to load the cache. I dont know why it was used in the first place. It only puts additional ~400kb to the client and gives awful loading times.

Read full topic
